<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BIOTECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/17/unpacking-promise-antibody-testing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Now If We’re Talkin’ Antibodies
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Antibody testing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzcvYW50aWJvZHlfdGVzdGluZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Robin Utretcht/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With widespread COVID-19 vaccines looking like a New Year's resolution for 2021, both the biotech and business communities are increasingly betting on <strong style="color:#000">antibody testing</strong> to get us back to some semblance of normal.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">To the la-bor-a-tory</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">First, Dee Dee get out. Now, what are antibodies? The Brew’s resident bio PhD (this writer’s sister) said, “Proteins that can recognize other proteins. That’s as simple as I can make it.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In the case of the coronavirus, certain antibodies can tell us whether a person has been exposed to the virus in the past—and if they’ve possibly </span><span><a href="https://www.latimes.com/science/story/2020-04-02/coronavirus-test-immunity-detection-accuracy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">developed immunity</a></span><span>. All it takes is a blood sample.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Antibody tests can give a more accurate tally of how many people have been unknowingly infected. In one California county, a </span><span><a href="https://abcnews.go.com/Health/antibody-research-coronavirus-widespread/story?id=70206121&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">large-scale community test</a></span><span> found between 50x and 80x more infections than originally reported.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Antibody tests could potentially help public health officials safely lift social distancing measures by indicating whether large swaths of the population have developed immunity.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The good news?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">More tests could be coming.</strong> Swiss pharma company Roche said yesterday it’s <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-17/roche-aims-to-start-selling-covid-19-antibody-test-in-early-may?sref=1crrKBaO&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">developed an antibody test</a> for COVID-19 that it plans to start selling early next month, and dozens of other companies have introduced similar tests. Some are as simple as an at-home pregnancy test; others require a medical professional to administer them.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But officials aren’t sold on antibody testing for several reasons: </strong>1) The <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/17/who-issues-warning-on-coronavirus-testing-theres-no-evidence-antibody-tests-show-immunity.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WHO warned</a> yesterday that these tests can't actually prove someone is immune to the coronavirus 2) there are concerns about accuracy and 3) without a centralized results database or uniform method for testing, we’re still flying relatively blind.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Many experts say reliable antibody testing to determine immunity could take as long to develop and distribute as a vaccine. But that hasn’t stopped biotech companies like Roche from taking advantage of relaxed regulations to give it their best shot.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F04%2F17%2Funpacking-promise-antibody-testing" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CONSUMER GOODS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/17/pg-reports-biggest-us-sales-bump-decades-covid-surge?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
One Investor’s Trash is P&G’s Treasure
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="toilet paper " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzgvdG9pbGV0X3BhcGVyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re calling it now: a surge in babies named Febreze, Downy, and Tide Pod in January. It only makes sense considering all the time we’re spending...cleaning.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Another side effect?</strong> Household products giant Procter & Gamble tallied its <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/procter-gamble-posts-biggest-u-s-sales-gain-in-decades-11587121202?mod=hp_lead_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest U.S. sales increase</a> in decades last quarter.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fabric and home care revenue spiked 10% and healthcare sales 9%. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>However, sales at P&G’s grooming and beauty divisions dipped 1% and rose 1%, respectively, as we put dramatically less effort into our appearances. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>P&G’s sales clearly got a boost from COVID-19. And while execs were satisfied with last quarter’s attitude of “clean clothes, full pantries, can’t lose,” they warned of <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/77903080-0254-419c-92cb-31387f48c382?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">future volatility</a> given widespread unemployment and retail closures.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Another big question:</strong> Post COVID-19, will we keep handwashing even when someone else isn't in the bathroom? P&G CFO Jon Moeller thinks so—he says our newfound appreciation for hygiene <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-17/procter-gamble-s-sales-gain-on-increased-consumer-demand?sref=1crrKBaO&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will outlast the pandemic</a>, which could mean more solid earnings for P&G.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/17/nasa-targets-may-27-historic-spacex-launch?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We Will Do Anything to Get on This Mission
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="SpaceX" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzYvc3BhY2V4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SpaceX</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NASA announced yesterday that it’s targeting a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/17/21225163/nasa-spacex-crew-dragon-falcon-9-commercial-dm-2-first-crewed-launch?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">May 27 launch date</a> to send two astronauts to the International Space Station aboard a SpaceX rocket. That’d be one small step for man, one giant leap for everyone who’s said “what planet are we living on” in the last month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It is an enormous step for one specific man:</strong> Elon Musk. This NASA launch will be <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/17/science/spacex-nasa-crew-dragon.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the first on a rocket</a> owned by a private company—Musk’s SpaceX.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Musk founded SpaceX in 2002 with the goal of enabling people to </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-17/nasa-sets-date-for-first-ever-astronaut-flight-on-spacex-rocket?srnd=premium&sref=1crrKBaO&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">live on other planets</a></span><span>. This will be the first time it flies humans.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If successful, it’ll give SpaceX a leg up over Boeing, which also has a NASA contract to fly astronauts to the ISS.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">As for NASA, </strong>this means more money for freeze-dried ice cream. Its astronauts have been schlepping to Russia to get to and from the ISS, to the tune of <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/technology/493338-nasa-sets-date-for-spacex-launch?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$83 million per seat</a>. This launch will be the first flight of NASA crews from U.S. soil since 2011.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/17/huge-espn-last-dance-premieres-sunday-night?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
MJ’s Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Michael Jordan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=384 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/634/jordan.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Michael Jordan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/634/jordan.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It looks like we might finally have weekend plans. On Sunday, ESPN and Netflix are releasing the first two episodes of the massively hyped 10-part Michael Jordan docuseries, “The Last Dance,” providing an in-depth look into the Chicago Bulls’s 1997–98 season.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>ESPN started its <em>30 for 30</em> documentary franchise in 2009 to celebrate its 30th anniversary—30 films to celebrate 30 years of covering sports. Since then, the franchise has grown to include over 90 films, including critically acclaimed specials like “OJ: Made in America.” </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Enter “His Airness”</h2>
<div class="c-message_kit__gutter">
<div class="c-message_kit__gutter__right" data-qa="message_content">
<div class="c-message_kit__blocks c-message_kit__blocks--rich_text">
<div class="c-message__message_blocks c-message__message_blocks--rich_text">
<div class="p-block_kit_renderer" data-qa="block-kit-renderer">
<div class="p-block_kit_renderer__block_wrapper p-block_kit_renderer__block_wrapper--first">
<div class="p-rich_text_block" dir="auto">
<div class="p-rich_text_section">If Michael Jordan had Scottie Pippen, "The Last Dance" has mass stay-at-home orders leaving viewers with all the time in the world to stream videos.</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/bhofheimer_espn/status/1250795366380945408?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">current record</a></span><span> for a </span><span><em>30 for 30</em></span><span> documentary premiere is “You Don’t Know Bo” with 3.6 million viewers on Dec. 8, 2012. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The MJ doc is expected to top that. As the LA Times </span><span><a href="https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/tv/story/2020-04-14/espn-netflix-michael-jordan-documentary-the-last-dance-chicago-bulls?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a></span><span>, it's not just a TV show..."it's a cultural event."  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> With a virtual NFL draft scheduled to begin on Thursday, April 23, ESPN finally has some non-obscure sports programming in the pipeline. Here’s a <a href="https://twitter.com/SportsCenter/status/1250870154612924416?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cornhole highlight</a> if that makes you sad. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Bonus question: </strong>Did we choose the right Jordan GIF? One of the most difficult decisions a newsletter writer can make.</p>

</span>

</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reading books in quarantine</strong> is great because 1) a book placed next to coffee makes for a quality Instagram Story pic and 2) a book will never ask if you want to “continue reading.” For some recommendations, check out the latest installment of <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/08/brews-bookshelf-april-9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf</a>, where we're sharing our team’s favorite business-related reads.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of these headlines is not like the others. Namely, real. Can you spot the news headline we made up? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Following complaints, Brooklyn block </span><span><a href="https://giphy.com/gifs/bafta-baftas-bafta-film-awards-2019-iAQiHcZbjApk84kXrO/fullscreen?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">institutes auditions</a></span><span> for 7pm cheering”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Sourd.io is like a </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/17/21224787/sourd-io-sourdough-starter-diy-fitness-tracker-yeast-twilio-narrowband?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fitness tracker</a></span><span> for your sourdough starter”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Dating app Bumble </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-13/covid-19-bumble-grants-women-led-small-businesses-get-lifelines?campaign_id=4&emc=edit_dk_20200414&instance_id=17623&nl=dealbook&regi_id=83342785&segment_id=25099&te=1&user_id=6e8f5c5256f51c870f4df90ca819260d&sref=1crrKBaO&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">provides small-business cash</a></span><span> faster than U.S."</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“A Florida bar </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/hott-leggz-florida-bar-dollars-from-its-walls-donates-staff-2020-4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pulled down $10,000</a></span><span> in single bills stuck to the wall so it could pay its 22 unemployed workers”</span>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFirst, Dee Dee get out. Now, what are antibodies? The Brew’s resident bio PhD (this writer’s sister) said, “Proteins that can recognize other proteins. That’s as simple as I can make it.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn the case of the coronavirus, certain antibodies can tell us whether a person has been exposed to the virus in the past—and if they’ve possibly \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/science/story/2020-04-02/coronavirus-test-immunity-detection-accuracy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeveloped immunity\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. All it takes is a blood sample.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAntibody tests can give a more accurate tally of how many people have been unknowingly infected. In one California county, a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/Health/antibody-research-coronavirus-widespread/story?id=70206121\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elarge-scale community test\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e found between 50x and 80x more infections than originally reported.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Antibody tests could potentially help public health officials safely lift social distancing measures by indicating whether large swaths of the population have developed immunity.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe good news?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore tests could be coming.\u003c/strong\u003e Swiss pharma company Roche said yesterday it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-17/roche-aims-to-start-selling-covid-19-antibody-test-in-early-may?sref=1crrKBaO\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeveloped an antibody test\u003c/a\u003e for COVID-19 that it plans to start selling early next month, and dozens of other companies have introduced similar tests. Some are as simple as an at-home pregnancy test; others require a medical professional to administer them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut officials aren’t sold on antibody testing for several reasons: \u003c/strong\u003e1) The \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/17/who-issues-warning-on-coronavirus-testing-theres-no-evidence-antibody-tests-show-immunity.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWHO warned\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that these tests can't actually prove someone is immune to the coronavirus 2) there are concerns about accuracy and 3) without a centralized results database or uniform method for testing, we’re still flying relatively blind.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Many experts say reliable antibody testing to determine immunity could take as long to develop and distribute as a vaccine. But that hasn’t stopped biotech companies like Roche from taking advantage of relaxed regulations to give it their best shot.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" Downy, and Tide Pod in January. It only makes sense considering all the time we’re spending...cleaning.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnother side effect?\u003c/strong\u003e Household products giant Procter \u0026 Gamble tallied its \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/procter-gamble-posts-biggest-u-s-sales-gain-in-decades-11587121202?mod=hp_lead_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest U.S. sales increase\u003c/a\u003e in decades last quarter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFabric and home care revenue spiked 10% and healthcare sales 9%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHowever, sales at P\u0026G’s grooming and beauty divisions dipped 1% and rose 1%, respectively, as we put dramatically less effort into our appearances. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eP\u0026G’s sales clearly got a boost from COVID-19. And while execs were satisfied with last quarter’s attitude of “clean clothes, full pantries, can’t lose,” they warned of \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/77903080-0254-419c-92cb-31387f48c382?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efuture volatility\u003c/a\u003e given widespread unemployment and retail closures.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnother big question:\u003c/strong\u003e Post COVID-19, will we keep handwashing even when someone else isn't in the bathroom? P\u0026G CFO Jon Moeller thinks so—he says our newfound appreciation for hygiene \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-17/procter-gamble-s-sales-gain-on-increased-consumer-demand?sref=1crrKBaO\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNASA announced yesterday that it’s targeting a \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/17/21225163/nasa-spacex-crew-dragon-falcon-9-commercial-dm-2-first-crewed-launch?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMay 27 launch date\u003c/a\u003e to send two astronauts to the International Space Station aboard a SpaceX rocket. That’d be one small step for man, one giant leap for everyone who’s said “what planet are we living on” in the last month.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt is an enormous step for one specific man:\u003c/strong\u003e Elon Musk. This NASA launch will be \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/17/science/spacex-nasa-crew-dragon.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe first on a rocket\u003c/a\u003e owned by a private company—Musk’s SpaceX.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMusk founded SpaceX in 2002 with the goal of enabling people to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-17/nasa-sets-date-for-first-ever-astronaut-flight-on-spacex-rocket?srnd=premium\u0026sref=1crrKBaO\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elive on other planets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. This will be the first time it flies humans.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf successful, it’ll give SpaceX a leg up over Boeing, which also has a NASA contract to fly astronauts to the ISS.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAs for NASA, \u003c/strong\u003ethis means more money for freeze-dried ice cream. Its astronauts have been schlepping to Russia to get to and from the ISS, to the tune of \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/technology/493338-nasa-sets-date-for-spacex-launch?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$83 million per seat\u003c/a\u003e. This launch will be the first flight of NASA crews from U.S. soil since 2011.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt looks like we might finally have weekend plans. On Sunday, ESPN and Netflix are releasing the first two episodes of the massively hyped 10-part Michael Jordan docuseries, “The Last Dance,” providing an in-depth look into the Chicago Bulls’s 1997–98 season.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eESPN started its \u003cem\u003e30 for 30\u003c/em\u003e documentary franchise in 2009 to celebrate its 30th anniversary—30 films to celebrate 30 years of covering sports.
